title: Panel
text:
In the late eighteenth century, woven textile designs shifted from the large, elaborate patterns of the Rococo style to the more restrained taste of the Neo-Classical style. Sprays of small flowers accompany thin bands of <I>rocaille<I> (shell encrusted or pebbly) motifs, woven with gold and silver, as well as multi-colored threads.

This panel may have been part of a furniture fabric for a matched set of chairs and sofas used in an elegant French reception room.
description: white silk satin brocaded with exotic floral design in orange, green, blue and purple
creditline: The Miscellaneous Works of Art Purchase Fund, Anonymous Gift of funds, by exchange
